Hmmm...  I've never really thought about it.  But now that you mention it, I've noticed it too.  I'm not quite sure myself, but I'll ask around.  I've got a friend who's an expert on the Samurai and Kenjitsu and such, who got me into it in the first place.  I'll ask him...
 
                                                                                  -Devin Parkman

Dean Wayland <dean@...> wrote:
Greetings All,

Can anyone tell me the significance of the commonly seen heraldic device
of a narrow band surmounted by a broad band, as seen upon many hata,
nobori, tate etc. I've seen it on contemporary illustrations used by
both sides in a battle. Is it a religious or tactical motif or what?

Yours

Dean
